page.title: 02THE VILLAGE SCHOOL HENFIELD
page.content: Originally there were three schools in Henfield, a Boys', a Girls' and an Infants'. The Girls' School is now a house with the old school bell outside. The Infant School is now used by the Youth Club. It is next to the Old Workhouse which are now homes. The Boys'School which is on the Common, was used up to l983 when the present school site at Fabians Way was completed and the Common School was closed. It is now being converted into three houses. Our school was built in different stages. There are twelve classrooms and a Hall. Two classrooms are on the second storey and there is a view of the farmlands and Cowfold Monastery. There is a field for games,a large asphalt playground and best of all a covered heated swimming pool.
